conclusion: Use the ideal gas law and properties of the hyperbola in the pV diagram.
Identify the Ideal Gas Law: pV = nRT.
Understand the hyperbola: segment BC represents a hyperbola in the pV diagram, implying pV = constant (isothermal process).
Determine the constant for state A using the ideal gas law.
At state A: p_A = 4 atm, V_A = 10 L.
Calculate nR for state A: nR = 2/15.
Apply the constant to state C using pV = constant.
At state C: p_C = 2 atm, V_C = 40 L.
The temperature of the gas in state C is 600K.
